intro: Isocoma palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky areas. Its leaves are generally linear to lance-shaped, and the flowers are small, blue to purple in color. Isocoma palmeri is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, adapting to harsh environmental conditions.
